It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying shades of white or pale yellow.
